description: Stuntcar Extreme Advanced is a graphically recreated version of the game Stuntcar Extreme. This enhanced version uses the 3D hardware capabilities of the Dell Axim x50v PDA, which the game is bundled with. The advanced version has different set of tracks and cars. It doesn't contain the story driven game which is present in the original Stuntcar Extreme.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bonus points shown after a successful stunt jump
In-car view on Ring of Fire track
Car falling on Construction Sights track
Approaching a ring of fire on Rollercoaster track
Stallion and Sce Petit cars on Construction Sights track

title: Stuntcar Extreme Advanced

description:
Pocket UFO is a remake of the classic X-COM: UFO Defense for Pocket PC devices.

In the game you run X-COM, an international organization formed to combat aliens invading earth. On the strategic front, it will be your job to manage the organization, hire staff, buy equipment, conduct research and more. On the tactical front, you will send soldiers to carry out combat missions on downed UFOs and enemy bases.

Building bases, assigning research, hiring and allocating stuff and equipment is done on the global world map. Research is essential to the development of the technologies you will need to defeat the aliens. Engineers will implement these technologies, building better equipment. You can build several bases in different areas of the globe. In each base you will have several facilities such as living quarters for your staff, research laboratories, and hangars for aircraft. You will have to send out craft to intercept and shoot down UFOs discovered on the radar, and then a troop to clear the area of the downed UFO. This is when the combat missions start.

Combat is isometric view and turn-based. Each soldier has a limited amount of time-units to use each turn for moving around, shooting, crouching, etc. At the end of your turn the aliens take their turn and so on. The skill and experience of your soldiers, the time of day, the terrain are some of the factors that affect combat.

Pocket UFO is very faithful to the original game - and recreates the classic mixture of strategy and tactics.
title: Pocket UFO

description: In Joker's Quest you control Joker, a little clown fish on his journey trough puzzle-filled levels. The princess has been kidnapped by an evil octopus and only Joker, the court jester of the kingdom, can save her. The game is a puzzle game similar to Boulder Dash where the player has to clear a path through the levels while avoiding the different objects that fall down according to gravity. The game features switches, bombs and numerous enemies through all of the 125 underwater levels.
title: Joker's Quest

description:
Age of Empires: Pocket PC Edition is a conversion of Age of Empires: Gold Edition PC version. It keeps most of the features and functions of the PC version, and has both original Age of Empires elements and the The Rise of Rome expansion enhancements. Given limits inherent to Windows Mobile based Pocket PC devices, not all elements from the PC game could be converted.

The following are not in the Pocket PC Edition:

  • No multiplayer support
  • No support for large random map games
  • No Windows Mobile based Pocket PC campaign editor

If players have the PC campaign editor they can create games and download them for use on Windows Mobile Pocket PC Edition.

sample_screenshots.caption: Caesar vs the Pirates - playing against bots

title: Age of Empires: Pocket PC Edition

description:
Anthelion: Galactic Alliance is a combat space sim that leans towards action gameplay. In there you play as a rogue-ish space bedouin in war-torn galaxy, where both of the engaged factions, The Federation and The Locusts share a dislike for pirates. There are sixteen story-based missions with cutscenes, and five playable ships and several weapons to choose along the way.

Anthelion is played from a first person view and features true 3D graphics. It looks similar to many space-combat games like Wing Commander, Gunship Elite. The game contains an original soundtrack that spans over half an hour. Controls are possible via touch screen or D-Pad.
title: Anthelion: Galactic Alliance

description:
FIFA Soccer 2002 is an early mobile release in the FIFA series. The game is played from a top down perspective and uses a mix of stylus and button controls. Tapping and holding down the stylus moves a player around while lifting the stylus and then tapping again leads to a pass being made. Shooting is done by pressing a button, and holding it down gives extra height, but it is also possible to use the stylus to add aftertouch and curve the ball's movement.

In addition to single matches and a practice mode, the game contains a FIFA World Cup Qualifier mode which despite its name is the actual 2002 World Cup. All 32 teams are included and they are grouped like in the real tournament. The best teams in each group goes through to the knockout stages where each match has to be won to reach the final qualifier game. The game also contains teams from six national leagues but these can only be played in friendlies.
title: FIFA Soccer 2002

description:
Soccer Addict: 2002 International Cup is a football game for touch screen devices that uses stylus controls. The game is played from a top down perspective and by tapping the screen the marked player will run in that direction. Running with ball is done by holding down the stylus and moving around. Shooting and passing is done by drawing a line from one player to another or towards the goal. When in defence, line drawing is used to make tackles. A short line is used for standard tackles while longer lines lead to sliding tackles.

The game contains three game modes: exhibition, tournaments and shootouts. Exhibition is single matches between any two of the game's national teams. The tournament mode involves competing against seven randomly selected teams in a knockout competition. There are three difficulty levels that need to be unlocked in order. The shootout mode is a game of penalties which unlike the main game is played from a behind view.
title: Soccer Addict: 2002 International Cup

description:
Baseball Addict is a baseball game for touch screen devices that uses stylus controls. Pitching and batting is done from a behind view of the hitter while commanding the field players is done from a top down view. When pitching the player chooses one of three pitch types before setting destination and power by holding down the stylus. When batting taking a swing is done by simple tapping on the screen where the ball crosses the plate. After a hit the player taps on the ground to move the fielders and taps on bases on a mini map to make them throw the ball. Runners are controlled by drawing lines between bases.

There are three game modes: exhibition, tournaments and homerun derbys. An exhibition is a single game between any two teams. Tournaments are knockout competitions consisting of quarter finals, semi finals and finals. There are three levels that have to be completed in order. Homerun derbys are all about batting and hitting the most homeruns.
title: Baseball Addict

description: Infectious Ground is a first person shooter for Pocket PC PDAs. Taking place in the year 2088, the player is an elite space marine who is sent to a space colony that has been attacked by alien insects. The game consists of a campaign of 21 missions divided into nine different world with extra missions being downloadable from the game's website. Environments include deserted streets, a nuclear power plant and the deadly alien nest. Eight different alien species are there to be fought and enemies include insects such as roaches, scorpions and dragonflies as well as their queens. Levels end with large boss fights. Weapons include a chain gun, a rocket launcher and a snipe gun. There is also a remote camera that can used to search for traps. The game is played with a combination of buttons and stylus.
title: Infectious Ground

description:
Scarface: Money. Power. Respect. is a mobile game based on the 1983 movie. The player takes control of Tony Montana as he goes from rags to riches.

The gameplay is similar to the Grand Theft Auto. The player is free to roam the in-game city of Miami and choose which missions they would like to complete. Players can hide from the police by entering a safehouse. Completing missions will give players money which they can spend on better weapons and new safehouses. Players can steal cars and are offered 2 different control schemes for steering, accelerating and breaking. Players may also enter buildings and may be required to do so to complete some of the missions. The game adds a nice touch by playing different tunes when Tony is driving a car, simulating a radio.

Combat is semi-automatic with the player pressing a key to take out their guns and the protagonist shooting the closest enemies automatically. The only thing players can change is the target that Tony is shooting. Players will need to dodge fire from Tony's enemies while he battles them.

sample_screenshots.caption: The pause menu and the map of the city.
Money can be spent on a few things, like better weapons.
Tony shoots his enemies automatically and I can only choose whom I want him to shoot.
After delivering the second "package" I received this message.

title: Scarface: Money. Power. Respect.

description: Colotiles is a puzzle game played on a grid with blue, green and red tiles. The objective of the game is to color all the tiles blue. Tiles have arrows on them and clicking on one turns all tiles in its direction into its color. Green and red arrows at the same time rotate 90 degrees clockwise or counterclockwise. Each level has to be completed before time runs out. Turning tiles blue lead to extra time being given while turning tiles red or green decreases the time left.
title: Colotiles

description:
Fade is a point-and-click adventure game with a style and gameplay similar to Myst or the Zork games. The game is set in present-day France and the player controls a man called Louis who lives with his wife Anne. He has been suffering from amnesia since he was young. By exploring various locations he slowly discovers the truth between the blackouts he occasionally has.

Next to exploration there is puzzle-solving involving items stored in an inventory and dialogue sequences have branching trees. Originally released in French, it was later translated into English.
title: Fade

description:
Exit Nights is game that takes place in the Exit Night Club. It is based around card games with 40 different challengers until eventually facing the club boss. There are 344 cards to collect and decks need to be assembled to participate in the different leagues.

The game allows for exploration using 360 degrees. There are three main characters to choose from and three tournaments. The card gameplay rewards combos and multiplayer is supported as well as various statistics.
title: Exit Nights

description:
Retro Detonation is a Bomberman-like game. It contains 5 worlds with different themes, 10 levels in each of them. Each level is procedurally generated.

The game has two modes: classical, similar to the original Bomberman; and advanced with different types of weapons and bonuses that can be bought in a shop. There are 20 bonuses and 4 weapons in total.
title: Retro Detonation

description:
Galaxy Gate is a puzzle game. The player takes on the role of a customs intern at a space freight transport station whose job is to inspect containers for explosives and contraband.

The player operates scanning rays of different colors that can detect different types of illegal goods. By the end of each level, the player must mark all the containers with explosives for the bomb squad to diffuse them and confiscate all the illegal goods. Opening a container without anything illegal results in a fine for the main character. There's a time limit for each level.
title: Galaxy Gate

description: Foo Fighter is a vertical side-scrolling shooter. The player takes on a role of a pilot of a fighter aircraft exploring the Solar System. There are five different planets in the game.
title: Foo Fighter
